required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 10, 2017
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Paracervical Block for Pain Associated With Laminaria Insertion
clinical_study.official_title: Paracervical Block for Pain Associated With Laminaria Insertion

brief_summary.textblock: To assess if paracervical block is effective at reducing discomfort during placement of intracervical laminaria for pre-operative cervical preparation.

detailed_description.textblock: Pre-operative dilation of the cervix with use of osmotic dilators (e.g. laminaria, dilapan-S) is commonly done prior to pregnancy termination to make the procedure safer. This study seeks to assess whether paracervical blocks are effective at reducing pain associated with placement of laminaria. Secondarily, this study will evaluate if paracervical blocks are effective at reducing overall procedural pain and increasing overall patient satisfaction for the intracervical laminaria placement procedure.

primary_outcome.measure: Pain after placement of laminaria (100 mm VAS)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Measured within 10 seconds after placement of laminaria
primary_outcome.description: The research assistant will assess the participant's pain on the 100 mm VAS

secondary_outcome.measure: Satisfaction with overall pain control and the overall procedure (100 mm VAS)
secondary_outcome.description: Patients will rate satisfaction on the 100 mm VAS

secondary_outcome.measure: Pain during other steps in the laminaria insertion procedure (100 mm VAS)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pain will be measured at baseline; within 10 seconds after placement of speculum; within 10 seconds of paracervical block or sham block; 15 minutes after end of procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Patients will rate pain on the 100 mm VAS

arm_group.description: A paracervical block will be done prior to the placement of laminaria with 1% lidocaine and sodium bicarbonate.
A sham block will be done prior to the placement of laminaria using a capped needle

intervention.description: Performance of paracervical block, using 18 mL of 1% lidocaine buffered with 2 mL 8.4% sodium bicarbonate, prior to laminaria insertion
A capped needle will be placed on the cervix prior to laminaria insertion for purposes of blinding both the participant and research staff assessing outcomes

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant women between the ages of 18-49 years
- Desiring surgical termination of pregnancy or surgical management of a fetal demise
- Treatment plan involves cervical preparation with laminaria
- Participant able to provide informed consent in English and willing to participate in the study
Exclusion Criteria:
- Unable to read/speak/understand English
- Contraindications to receiving lidocaine
